To begin filming, a script is required. The task of adapting the immensely popular book series by J.K. Rowling for the big screen went to screenwriter Steve Kloves. He wrote the scripts for seven out of the eight films. However, for one of the installments he wasn't available, so Michael Goldenberg stepped in. He gave voice to new characters such as the horrible Dolores Umbridge and the quirky Luna Lovegood. Which film did he write the screenplay for?
answers: harry potter and the order of the phoenix
